corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

sentence.text: A close scrutiny of films showing lions killing zebras does not bear this out .
Unfortunately the detailed work on which that revision is itself based has only been published in Soviet journals in Russian , so has not stood the test of scrutiny by Western astronomers .
Each process had to undergo careful scrutiny by the Environmental Health Department , and the cooks had to pass medical tests .
And less than two years after Woking sent Brian Talbot to the Job Centre , Albion 's Cup mettle will be subjected to nationwide scrutiny by Sky cameras .
All company resolutions are subject to scrutiny by the court .
The Conservatives seemed rather more favourable to the prospect of scrutiny by backbench committees , perhaps because they felt that such a challenge would help to restrain public expenditure .
The accounts of local authorities are subject to scrutiny by auditors appointed by the Audit Commission .
They note that some explanations of FDI appeal to the existence of market failures and imperfect competition , and hence imply the need for careful scrutiny by competition authorities .
They have demonstrated publicly , through close scrutiny by their peers , that they know what they are talking about .
A FURTHER legal hitch to the Maastricht bill was under urgent scrutiny by government lawyers last night .
It would require them to conform to stricter accounting and electoral procedures , and suggests scrutiny by the National Audit Office .
The new Pro Arte Acrylix brush comes under close scrutiny from acrylic expert Richard Smith .
Despite , or perhaps because of , these successes Channel Four is also under scrutiny from the ideologues and reformers .
Being a costly enterprise and having many uses to the modern state , research has at the same time come under increased scrutiny from the paymaster .
Lucien did so , and behind him he felt a kindling of curious scrutiny from the musicians .
The scrutiny of a presidential candidate 's private life never used to be so intense .
It was her inevitable fate that an imperfect marriage and the relentless scrutiny of the modern royals would fray away the mantle of the Fairytale Princess .
A thorough prior scrutiny of guidebook descriptions and diagrams can help greatly to find the general line of such descents .
Thus there was no House of Commons scrutiny of public expenditure and virtually no understanding of how the decisions had been reached .
` Who knows , " she murmured , ` what a thorough scrutiny of your books might have revealed ?
In their timeless silence they endured his scrutiny , revealing nothing .
As if aware of his scrutiny and annoyed by it , she jerked Blazer 's head round and turned the horse 's tail towards Tom .
On the return journey he told her all about himself and he held up his left hand for her scrutiny .
His brows drew together , uneasy at her scrutiny .
There was nothing unpleasant in his scrutiny , no hint of lechery or desire , yet she felt deeply uncomfortable standing there before him , clad in only a few minute scraps of cloth .

His football club , Olympique Marseille , has come under police scrutiny .
Nelson 's detailed account is well worth close scrutiny for it illustrates many aspects of socio-ecology most cogently .

Further south he hoped his scuffed reefer jacket , corduroy trousers , boots and forage cap , worn by so many German farm workers , would escape scrutiny .

Partly as a result of the shortcomings in the Nuclear Non - Proliferation Treaty ( NPT ) safeguards system -- which allowed the rapid development of the Iraqi nuclear program in the 1970s and North Korea 's in the 1990s to go largely undetected -- and partly by assessing Iran 's intentions , the international community and the International Atomic Energy Agency ( IAEA ) have increased their scrutiny of Iran 's activities over the last several years .

These facilities and Iran 's overall program are currently undergoing close scrutiny by the international community and will likely remain so until controversy over the facilities ' purpose and capability can be resolved .
Like many facilities throughout the United States and Western Europe that have similar or even more advanced capabilities , these facilities are open to public scrutiny .
Nonetheless , countries suspected of having clandestine nuclear weapons programs are the subject of intense scrutiny by nonproliferation analysts , intelligence agencies , and other observers .
